Browse the source code of netbsd/external/lgpl3/mpfr/dist/src/set.c

1/* mpfr_set -- copy of a floating-point number
2
3Copyright 1999, 2001-2018 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
4Contributed by the AriC and Caramba projects, INRIA.
5
6This file is part of the GNU MPFR Library.
7
8The GNU MPFR Library is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify
9it under the terms of the GNU Lesser General Public License as published by
10the Free Software Foundation; either version 3 of the License, or (at your
11option) any later version.
12
13The GNU MPFR Library is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but
14WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY
15or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU Lesser General Public
16License for more details.
17
18You should have received a copy of the GNU Lesser General Public License
19along with the GNU MPFR Library; see the file COPYING.LESSER. If not, see
20http://www.gnu.org/licenses/ or write to the Free Software Foundation, Inc.,
2151 Franklin St, Fifth Floor, Boston, MA 02110-1301, USA. */
22
23#include "mpfr-impl.h"
24
25/* set a to abs(b) * signb: a=b when signb = SIGN(b), a=abs(b) when signb=1 */
26MPFR_HOT_FUNCTION_ATTR int
27mpfr_set4 (mpfr_ptr a, mpfr_srcptr b, mpfr_rnd_t rnd_mode, int signb)
28{
29 /* Sign is ALWAYS copied */
30 MPFR_SET_SIGN (a, signb);
31
32 /* Exponent is also always copied since if the number is singular,
33 the exponent field determined the number.
34 Can't use MPFR_SET_EXP since the exponent may be singular */
35 MPFR_EXP (a) = MPFR_EXP (b);
36
37 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (MPFR_IS_SINGULAR (b)))
38 {
39 /* MPFR_SET_NAN, MPFR_SET_ZERO and MPFR_SET_INF are useless
40 since MPFR_EXP (a) = MPFR_EXP (b) does the job */
41 if (MPFR_IS_NAN (b))
42 MPFR_RET_NAN;
43 else
44 MPFR_RET (0);
45 }
46 else if (MPFR_PREC (b) == MPFR_PREC (a))
47 {
48 /* Same precision and b is not singular:
49 * just copy the mantissa, and set the exponent and the sign
50 * The result is exact. */
51 MPN_COPY (MPFR_MANT (a), MPFR_MANT (b), MPFR_LIMB_SIZE (b));
52 MPFR_RET (0);
53 }
54 else
55 {
56 int inex;
57
58 /* Else Round B inside a */
59 MPFR_RNDRAW (inex, a, MPFR_MANT (b), MPFR_PREC (b), rnd_mode, signb,
60 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (++ MPFR_EXP (a) > __gmpfr_emax))
61 return mpfr_overflow (a, rnd_mode, signb)
62 );
63 MPFR_RET (inex);
64 }
65}
66
67/* Set a to b */
68#undef mpfr_set
69int
70mpfr_set (mpfr_ptr a, mpfr_srcptr b, mpfr_rnd_t rnd_mode)
71{
72 return mpfr_set4 (a, b, rnd_mode, MPFR_SIGN (b));
73}
74
75/* Set a to |b| */
76#undef mpfr_abs
77int
78mpfr_abs (mpfr_ptr a, mpfr_srcptr b, mpfr_rnd_t rnd_mode)
79{
80 return mpfr_set4 (a, b, rnd_mode, MPFR_SIGN_POS);
81}
82
83/* Round (u, inex) into s with rounding mode rnd, where inex is the ternary
84 value associated to u with the *same* rounding mode.
85 Assumes PREC(u) = 2*PREC(s).
86 The main algorithm is the following:
87 rnd=RNDZ: inex2 = mpfr_set (s, u, rnd_mode); return inex2 | inex;
88 (a negative value, if any, is preserved in inex2 | inex)
89 rnd=RNDA: idem
90 rnd=RNDN: inex2 = mpfr_set (s, u, rnd_mode);
91 if (inex2) return inex2; else return inex; */
92int
93mpfr_set_1_2 (mpfr_ptr s, mpfr_srcptr u, mpfr_rnd_t rnd_mode, int inex)
94{
95 mpfr_prec_t p = MPFR_PREC(s);
96 mpfr_prec_t sh = GMP_NUMB_BITS - p;
97 mp_limb_t rb, sb;
98 mp_limb_t *sp = MPFR_MANT(s);
99 mp_limb_t *up = MPFR_MANT(u);
100 mp_limb_t mask;
101 int inex2;
102
103 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(MPFR_IS_SINGULAR(u)))
104 {
105 mpfr_set (s, u, rnd_mode);
106 return inex;
107 }
108
109 MPFR_ASSERTD(MPFR_PREC(u) == 2 * MPFR_PREC(s));
110
111 if (MPFR_PREC(s) < GMP_NUMB_BITS)
112 {
113 mask = MPFR_LIMB_MASK(sh);
114
115 if (MPFR_PREC(u) <= GMP_NUMB_BITS)
116 {
117 mp_limb_t u0 = up[0];
118
119 /* it suffices to round (u0, inex) */
120 rb = u0 & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << (sh - 1));
121 sb = (u0 & mask) ^ rb;
122 sp[0] = u0 & ~mask;
123 }
124 else
125 {
126 mp_limb_t u1 = up[1];
127
128 /* we need to round (u1, u0, inex) */
129 mask = MPFR_LIMB_MASK(sh);
130 rb = u1 & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << (sh - 1));
131 sb = ((u1 & mask) ^ rb) | up[0];
132 sp[0] = u1 & ~mask;
133 }
134
135 inex2 = inex * MPFR_SIGN(u);
136 MPFR_SIGN(s) = MPFR_SIGN(u);
137 MPFR_EXP(s) = MPFR_EXP(u);
138
139 /* in case inex2 > 0, the value of u is rounded away,
140 thus we need to subtract something from (u0, rb, sb):
141 (a) if sb is not zero, since the subtracted value is < 1, we can leave
142 sb as it is;
143 (b) if rb <> 0 and sb = 0: change to rb = 0 and sb = 1
144 (c) if rb = sb = 0: change to rb = 1 and sb = 1, and subtract 1 */
145 if (inex2 > 0)
146 {
147 if (rb && sb == 0)
148 {
149 rb = 0;
150 sb = 1;
151 }
152 }
153 else /* inex2 <= 0 */
154 sb |= inex;
155
156 /* now rb, sb are the round and sticky bits, together with the value of
157 sp[0], except possibly in the case rb = sb = 0 and inex2 > 0 */
158 if (rb == 0 && sb == 0)
159 {
160 if (inex2 <= 0)
161 MPFR_RET(0);
162 else /* inex2 > 0 can only occur for RNDN and RNDA:
163 RNDN: return sp[0] and inex
164 RNDA: return sp[0] and inex */
165 MPFR_RET(inex);
166 }
167 else if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN)
168 {
169 if (rb == 0 || (sb == 0 && (sp[0] & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << sh)) == 0))
170 goto truncate;
171 else
172 goto add_one_ulp;
173 }
174 else if (MPFR_IS_LIKE_RNDZ(rnd_mode, MPFR_IS_NEG(s)))
175 {
176 truncate:
177 MPFR_RET(-MPFR_SIGN(s));
178 }
179 else /* round away from zero */
180 {
181 add_one_ulp:
182 sp[0] += MPFR_LIMB_ONE << sh;
183 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(sp[0] == 0))
184 {
185 sp[0] = MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT;
186 if (MPFR_EXP(s) + 1 <= __gmpfr_emax)
187 MPFR_SET_EXP (s, MPFR_EXP(s) + 1);
188 else /* overflow */
189 return mpfr_overflow (s, rnd_mode, MPFR_SIGN(s));
190 }
191 MPFR_RET(MPFR_SIGN(s));
192 }
193 }
194
195 /* general case PREC(s) >= GMP_NUMB_BITS */
196 inex2 = mpfr_set (s, u, rnd_mode);
197 return (rnd_mode != MPFR_RNDN) ? inex | inex2
198 : (inex2) ? inex2 : inex;
199}
